Il Jae Lee

Student by Day, Hacker by Night.
24/7 Rabbit Lover.

The Story
Hacking the life one second at a time.

I was allocated into the heap in 1995.
Every since the beginning, it was clear that for me to become a useful object in this world, that my member variable must be instantiated.
And thus started my long journey to lazy-instantiate my variables.
Even though I faced various challenges such as stack overflow, null pointers and segfaults, I've overcame them all and stand here today as Il Jae Lee.

... And now, a more sane introduction for those who aren't CS majors,

As you can see from the title my name full name is Il Jae Lee (이일재 in Korean), but I usually go by Jae or J.
I was born in Seoul - however, I spent most of my childhood in the city of Auckland, and culturally identify myself as a Kiwi (slang for New Zealand people).
I'm a self-taught programmer who initially started programming in hopes of creating a video game.
That interest evolved into a passion to create something that can bring an impact in the world (Check out some of the stuff I've made over here).
Other than programming, I enjoy snow/skateboarding (although I suck), spending time with my rabbit (you can check out a video of him here), drawing, eating sushi and teaching others.

I'm currently enrolled in Cranbrook Kingswood, Class of 2015.

Skills of Jae
Just incase you might want to give me an internship.

Coding with Love

I take deep pride the code that I write.
I usually put scaling considerations first when writing my code, and also make sure to check to write extensive unit tests.

Well Documented

Although I don't bombard the source code with comments, I write comments to where they are needed.

Passion

"If you don't love what you do, don't do it."
I love programming. I love solving new challenges. I love designing stuff with beauty and functionality in mind.
Don't I sound like a good fit for the job?

User-friendly

I am a very good communicator when it comes to getting stuff done.
Email me, tweet to me, talk to me, yell at me.
I can handle team work very well.
